Zhezhe, I've checked all your homework, and it's excellent! Now Mom is going to start washing the dishes. You, your brother, and your sister should get ready. You'll take turns taking a shower later, so don't get too absorbed in watching TV and forget the time.

Mom, I've made the shopping list and am going to the wet market and supermarket to buy New Year's goods, and I'll also get some hair dye. We'll have a simple lunch and prepare a proper dinner in the evening.
Auntie Sun, I'll come over this morning to buy some New Year's goods, including pork belly, chicken drumsticks, and some vegetables and fruits. I should arrive around 9:30.

Sister, Fen'er, shall we still hold the family meeting tomorrow afternoon at Mom's place? I have finished my shopping and will be free in the afternoon. I would like to confirm the care arrangements for Dad with you again.
Alright, Second Sister, I'll arrive at Mom's place before 2 PM tomorrow. How has Dad's blood pressure been recently? I bought some of his favorite snacks and will bring them over tomorrow.
My blood pressure is fine, and I'm taking my medication on time. Don't buy snacks that are too sweet. By the way, I ran into Shufen this morning, and she asked about you.

Sister, I've outlined several key points for tomorrow afternoon's meeting, mainly concerning supervision of Dad's medication, sharing of household chores for Mom, and our three sisters' fixed weekly companionship time. Please let me know if there's anything else that needs to be added.

Fen'er, regarding our parents, I've come up with an idea. We could take turns recording their daily physical and emotional conditions, which would make our communication more efficient. Let's discuss the details in person tomorrow.
Mom, is there any of the soup left from dinner? Xuanxuan said he'd like to have some more. We just finished watching TV and are about to rest.
[XX Community Clinic] Dear Ms. Ma, the winter health check-up you scheduled for your parents has been arranged for this Friday at 9:00 AM. Please bring the medical insurance card and arrive on time.

Mom, it's getting colder today. Please remember to wear more clothes when you and Dad go out to buy groceries, and don't forget your scarves and gloves. Everything is fine on my end, so don't worry about me.

Sister Xiuqin, I've sent you the video link for the Baduanjin exercise on WeChat. You should follow along and practice it—it's especially good for your back. I'll be tidying up at home this morning, waiting for you to come.
Sister, where are you? Fen'er has already arrived, and we're waiting for you to join us for tea. Please be careful on the way.
Honey, both your elder sister and younger sister have arrived. We're having a family dinner at home tonight. Could you pick up a bottle of soda on your way back from work? The kind the kids love.
Hello Teacher Han, this is Ma Mingxuan's mother. I would like to inquire about my child's recent performance at school. Please feel free to call or message me back at your convenience. Thank you.

Mom, my eldest sister and Fen'er came over for dinner tonight. We cooked several dishes and had a wonderful conversation. What did you and Dad have for dinner? It's getting cold, so please remember to keep warm.
Mom, I just dropped off Zhe Zhe and Xin Xin at school and am heading home now. Have you arrived at the square?
Xiulan, I have arrived at the square. The weather is nice today, suitable for practicing Baduanjin.
Sister Wang, I've arrived too and have seen my mom. Let's get started. Same time tomorrow, we'll meet without fail!

Honey, I just submitted the community window paper-cutting work. Director Zheng was very satisfied and gave me 500 yuan as a craftsmanship fee. What would you like for lunch? I'll go to the market in a little while.
Aunt Sun, I will come over around 9:30 today. Please keep two fresh crucian carp for me, and I also need one jin of pork ribs.

Sis, I saw the information about the senior care service center you shared in the group chat. It looks really good. Thank you for taking the trouble to share it. Shall we have a video call this weekend to discuss it in more detail?

Fen, I noticed there's a scheduling conflict with the housekeeping company job. I still need to submit a batch of handicraft work to the community next week. Are you free to discuss this over the phone tonight?
Okay, sis. I'll be free after 8 PM, and I'll call you then.

Mom, Zhiqiang and I were discussing elderly care information during dinner today. How have you and Dad been recently? It's getting cold, so please take extra care to keep warm. We'll come visit you this weekend.
Aunt Sun, Happy New Year! Is the market crowded today? I'd like to buy some fresh chives and cilantro to make dumplings. Do you still have good ones available?
Mom, I've made crucian carp soup and will bring it over for you and Dad around 9:30.
The soup has been delivered and is in the thermal container. Dad, Mom, I've placed it on the table. The New Year's Eve dinner is almost ready, so don't worry about it. I'm going back to clean up now.
Sister Xiuqin, Happy New Year! Thank you for your blessings. Let's get together with the handicraft group after the New Year. I've learned a new pattern, and we can study it together then.

Honey, the kitchen deep cleaning is done, and the meat filling for the New Year's Eve dinner is also prepared. When you finish your shift and come back tonight, could you please pick up a bottle of cooking wine and a bottle of cola on your way? We're out of them at home.

Honey, I forgot to mention during the inventory earlier. Dad's (Ma Jianguo) follow-up examination report is stored in the second drawer of the bedside cabinet. Please remember to take it with you when you visit the doctor tomorrow for the New Year's greetings.
Yes, I see. You're very thoughtful. Let's save up more next year and try to take our parents and kids to Beijing during the summer vacation. They've been talking about it for a long time.

Ms. Ma, we have confirmed the process for yesterday's order on our end, and we will proceed as we discussed. I will send you the final electronic version of the design draft later. Please prepare the materials accordingly.—Zheng Xiuying

Today at Aunt Sun's stall in the Taian Shengshijun Vegetable Market, besides buying vegetables, I also consulted her about selecting important household appliances, and she gave some suggestions. I'll share more when I get home.
I've seen the vest. The workwear style is sturdy and suitable for you to wear while working. I'll go buy it this weekend.
summarized_info: Discussing the purchase of workwear vests with my husband.

message_content: 【Postal Savings Bank of China】You deposited RMB 500.00 into your time deposit account at 15:40 on June 04. The current account balance is RMB 1,236.78. For details, please call 95580.
Chunmei, thank you for coming to chat with me yesterday, as I mentioned on the phone earlier. I feel much better now. Let's get together again when you have time!
Mom, the embroidery order is progressing well and is expected to be completed for delivery tomorrow.

Xiulan, I just spoke with your mother. Starting next week, the moxibustion therapy sessions will follow this schedule. I checked the calendar, and having them every other day works well. Thank you for your hard work.
Aunt Zhang, I will come over this afternoon to pick up the reserved jasmine tea and snacks. Thank you!
【Postal Savings Bank】Dear customer, a transfer of 3500.00 yuan was successfully made from your account ending with XXXX on June 20 for a time deposit. If you have any questions, please contact 95580.
The weather is extremely cold today, and my shoulders and neck are severely stiff, so the scheduled activity had to be canceled.
Today I finished sewing the cartoon patches on 20 children's scarves, and my hands are sore. But it's worth it, knowing that I can help my dad.
Sister Sun, I've bought the persimmons and will bring them over tomorrow. The spinach at the market today looks quite fresh.
Ma Xiufen: Sis, it's been hot lately. How are things on your end? Mom says Jinghai has been quite stuffy these days.
Ma Xiulan: Indeed, it's so hot that people feel listless. By the way, let me tell you something—our neighbor Sister Wang has been looking down in the dumps these past couple of days.
Ma Xiufen: What's wrong? What happened to her family?

Ma Xiulan: Her son works as a food delivery rider in the city. The night before last, he was in a hurry to deliver an order and, while riding an electric bike, he accidentally crashed into a roadside guardrail.

Ma Xiulan: She fell and scraped a large patch of skin off her knee, and the front wheel of her electric bike was knocked crooked. It will cost another sum of money to repair the bike. Fortunately, she wasn't seriously injured, but Sister Wang is both distressed and angry, saying the child is clumsy and careless.
Liu Chunmei: Xiulan, what TV shows have you been watching lately? I'm running out of things to watch.
Ma Xiulan: I'm watching that show called "Myriad Lights," which is about a big family's daily life. It's quite close to real life.
Liu Chunmei: Oh, that one. I've also glanced at it a couple of times. There are quite a few characters in it. Who is your favorite?

Ma Xiulan: My favorite is the second daughter in the story. She has a calm and unhurried temperament. When conflicts arise between the eldest brother and his wife, or when the parents argue with the younger brother, she is always the one who mediates and reconciles them.

Ma Xiulan: I believe a family needs someone like this—someone who holds everyone in their heart and whose words and actions put others at ease. Looking at her reminds me of our childhood; I always wanted to be that kind of peacemaker too, haha.
Liu Chunmei: Xiulan, what are you up to? I'm feeling a bit upset and would like to chat with you.
Ma Xiulan: I'm at home, just finished tidying up. What's up, Chunmei? Is everything okay at home?
Liu Chunmei: Not at home, it's my husband. He's been feeling quite frustrated at work recently, and comes home looking downcast.
Ma Xiulan: Huh? What happened? Are you having trouble at work?

Liu Chunmei: Well, a new young supervisor has been transferred to their unit, and he's really something. He said my partner works too slowly and can't keep up with their new workflow, and criticized him right in front of many people. After working all these years, he's never experienced anything like this. He felt deeply humiliated and hasn't been able to eat properly these past couple of days.

Zhou Xiuqin: Xiulan, when I went to the city over the weekend, I saw a long line outside a newly opened steamed bun shop. They say it's a trendy internet-famous spot. Since you love steamed buns, how about we go try it some other day?

Ma Xiulan: Sister Xiuqin, I might not be used to those trendy internet-famous restaurants. I'm quite picky about food and only really appreciate the flavors from those old shops on our Jinghai Old Street.
Zhou Xiuqin: Haha, that old shop is indeed reliable. So what kind specifically do you like? I see there are so many varieties of steamed buns nowadays.

Ma Xiulan: I prefer the old-fashioned style, with a thicker, chewier dough. The filling should be substantial, with a good balance of meat and vegetables—not just a pouch of oily broth. Nowadays, some buns use too much oil to make them appear juicier, but they end up feeling greasy and heavy. The traditional taste is much more satisfying and keeps you full longer.

Zhou Xiuqin: You're absolutely right! It's always the traditional craftsmanship that's most reliable. Then let's skip the trendy internet-famous spots next time and head straight to the old street to buy those thick-skinned, generously stuffed buns you love!

Chunmei, I really enjoyed our conversation yesterday. Thank you for sharing those experiences. I tried the massage technique you taught me on my mom last night, and she said it felt quite comfortable. I also noted down the pumpkin porridge recipe and will go buy the ingredients today. Let's keep in touch more often!

Ma Xiulan: I was at home last night, talking with Zhiqiang about driving. He shared his experience with night driving, such as how to handle high beams when encountering oncoming vehicles and what to pay attention to when overtaking.
Liu Chunmei: Xiulan, are you at home? I just came back from the market and heard from Aunt Sun that your skillful friend Zhou Xiuqin seems to have some issues at home.
Ma Xiulan: Chunmei, I'm at home. You're asking about Sister Xiuqin? What happened to her? We just made plans last week to study new embroidery patterns together this weekend.

Liu Chunmei: I heard about it too. It seems her mother-in-law accidentally fell and injured her leg back in their hometown in Hebei. It's quite serious—she can't get out of bed now and needs someone to take care of her around the clock. Sister Xiuqin might have to go back to her hometown for a while.

Ma Xiulan: Oh my, that must have been really tough. A fall is no small matter for an elderly person. No wonder she hasn't posted anything on her Moments these past couple of days. I hope the elderly person recovers quickly. It looks like we'll have to cancel our weekend gathering.

Liu Chunmei: Indeed, every family has its own troubles. But this doesn't really affect you; it just means you're missing a companion to work and chat with. You can get together again when she comes back in a while.
Ma Xiufen: Sis, I checked out that online store selling silk thread you asked me to look at last time. The color selection is indeed quite comprehensive. What new patterns are you working on lately?

Ma Xiulan: Fen'er, I've recently become quite fascinated with a particular color scheme. It feels exceptionally elegant and carries a touch of warmth. It's not like the overly festive reds and greens I used to favor.
Ma Xiufen: Oh? Tell me quickly, what color? I want to learn too, so I can embroider a new schoolbag for my daughter later.

Ma Xiulan: Use that soft lotus root color as the base—it's a bit like a light purple shade, which looks particularly clean and comfortable. Then, when embroidering or outlining on top, pair it with a touch of bean paste pink—not a bright pink, but a pink with a slightly grayish tone. When combined, it appears both gentle and high-end.

Ma Xiufen: Pale purple paired with bean paste pink? That sounds nice, quite elegant and understated, suitable for embroidering things like orchids or lotus flowers. Alright, I’ve noted it down. I’ll bring you some thread in those colors next time I go to the city.
Liu Chunmei: Xiulan, are you home? I just heard something, and it's left me feeling quite uneasy.
Ma Xiulan: I'm here, just tidying up the house. What's up, Chunmei? You don't sound right.
Liu Chunmei: It's our elementary school classmate Zhao Xiaohong, remember? The one who works as a cashier at the supermarket and speaks in a particularly straightforward manner.
Ma Xiulan: Of course I remember, Little Hong. What happened to her?

Liu Chunmei: Isn't her husband a technician at a factory in the development zone? Recently, the factory opened a new plant in the Binhai New Area and is transferring a group of key personnel there. Her husband was selected, and his compensation will increase significantly. So, their whole family will have to move to the Binhai New Area after the Spring Festival. It will be difficult to see each other from now on.
Zhou Xiuqin: Sister Xiulan, what new patterns have you been embroidering lately? The character 'Fu' you embroidered last time was truly beautiful.
Ma Xiulan: Sister Xiuqin, I was just about to tell you. Lately, for some reason, I've really taken to using maroon silk thread as the base. It looks so festive and dignified.
Zhou Xiuqin: Burgundy is good, it's elegant. So what color will you use to embroider the pattern?

Ma Xiulan: I tried several options and found that pairing it with off-white looks the best. It’s not as glaring as pure white—gentle and soft, yet the embroidered flowers, birds, and characters appear particularly clear and elegant. Compared to pairing it with gold or bright yellow, it feels more enduringly appealing.
Zhou Xiuqin: Burgundy paired with off-white, this combination sounds great! It has the festive cheer of the holiday season without being tacky. I'll give it a try sometime.
Just got home, my back is killing me. I think it's from being so busy and tired lately.
Me: Mom, the event just ended. I gave all the paper-cutting works I made to the elderly present, especially Grandma Li, who couldn't put down the 'longevity' character I cut.
Liu Chunmei: Xiulan, are you busy? I feel so upset and want to talk to you.
Ma Xiulan: Chunmei, what's wrong? I just finished tidying up the house and have some free time. Go ahead.
Liu Chunmei: Alas, it's because of my husband. He had an accident while working at the factory.
Ma Xiulan: Oh? Is it serious? Is everyone alright?

Liu Chunmei: The person is not seriously injured, but it was terrifying. While operating the machine, the entire fingernail of the right index finger was torn off, and blood gushed out immediately. We rushed him to the hospital, where he received several stitches. He is now lying at home, unable to work, and it's really worrying me.
Zhou Xiuqin: Xiulan, I recently saw the little tiger embroidery piece you shared in the group chat—it's really nice, and your stitches are getting tighter and more even.
Ma Xiulan: You flatter me, Sister Xiuqin. I've been experimenting with new patterns lately. I learned a technique called "seed embroidery" from watching videos and find it quite interesting.
Zhou Xiuqin: "Seed embroidery"? Is that the kind with raised, bead-like dots? That one is indeed quite labor-intensive.

Ma Xiulan: Yes, that's the one. Although it's more labor-intensive, the embroidery comes out with a strong three-dimensional effect and feels sturdy to the touch. I think it's particularly suitable for embroidering small animals or flowers on children's clothing—it's durable, doesn't wear out easily after many washes, and the designs look adorable. It's more interesting than flat embroidery, which lacks dimension.
Zhou Xiuqin: That's a great idea! Zhezhe and Xinxin will definitely love it. Next time we meet, you can teach me how to do it, and I'll try it with my grandson too.
Liu Chunmei: Xiulan, are you free this afternoon? I've just learned a new embroidery technique for peonies and would like to explore it together with you.
Ma Xiulan: Chunmei, this afternoon works. I happened to hear our neighbor Sister Wang sighing yesterday, so I'll go over and chat with her.
Liu Chunmei: What's wrong with Sister Wang? Are you feeling unwell?

Ma Xiulan: It's not about her health, she's worried about her son. Her son is almost thirty, and recently he's been set up on blind dates through introductions. He's met three or four girls in a row, but none of them worked out. Sister Wang is extremely anxious, saying that if this drags on any longer, it will be even harder to find someone.
Liu Chunmei: Sigh, all parents are like this. My husband also keeps talking about our daughter's future marriage. So, shall we meet up first this afternoon and then go see Sister Wang?
Ma Xiufen: Sis, are you going back to Mom's place for dinner this weekend? Mom says she misses you.
Ma Xiulan: Yes, I'll be back. Actually, I've been learning to cook from TV shows recently and want to practice my skills.
Ma Xiufen: Oh, what big dish are you learning? It wouldn't be that sweet and sour series you mentioned last time, would it?

Ma Xiulan: No, let's try something difficult this time - "Zengbeng Carp"! The master chef on TV made it so beautifully. The fish was fried until even the bones were crispy, yet the meat remained tender. When the sauce was poured over it, it sizzled with a "crackle."

Ma Xiulan: I think the hardest part is the "frying" step. The oil temperature and timing must be precisely controlled; otherwise, either the outside will be burnt while the inside remains undercooked, or the fish will fall apart and lose its shape—then it wouldn't be "Zengbeng" anymore. I really need to practice this step well.
Ma Xiufen: Wow, sis, you're aiming to be a master chef! Alright, I'll be waiting to taste your cooking this weekend. Even if it turns out burnt, it's fine—our family won't mind, haha.

Teacher Han: Ms. Ma, the two weak areas in Mingxuan's Chinese language skills mentioned during today's parent-teacher meeting are reading comprehension and essay writing. I have summarized the specific details for your reference. Please check your notes.

Wang Guilan: Xiulan, did you try the folk remedy I mentioned this morning? The one with tobacco leaves soaked in water—it works quite well. Remember to spray both the front and back of the leaves when applying it.

Honey, the kids have all been sent off, and the kitchen is tidied up. Breakfast is the usual combination—porridge and eggs, and steamed buns with pickles are kept warm for you in the pot. Remember to have them when you get up.
summarized_info: I sent a text message to my husband, informing him that the children have gone to school and mentioning that the breakfast left for him includes porridge, eggs, steamed buns, and pickles.

message_content: You look particularly energetic today, and your complexion is excellent! Thank you for your patronage.
Xiulan, the final payment for the handmade work has been transferred to you. The client said they are very satisfied with the items.
Chunmei: Xiulan, any good TV series recommendations lately? I've got nothing to do in the evenings.
Ma Xiulan: Chunmei, I've been watching that show "Splendid Years" recently. It's about a family and embroidery.
Chunmei: Oh? Is it good? What's it about?

Ma Xiulan: It's quite good. It tells about family matters and how the craftsmanship of the older generation is passed down. The mother in the story gave up embroidery for her children when she was young, and later taught her daughter while picking it up again herself. It almost brought me to tears, as it somewhat resembles my own experience.
Chunmei: Hearing you say that, it's truly touching. I'll look for it to watch later.
Aunt Wu (Handicraft Group): Sisters, I've been crocheting a cushion recently and can't decide on the color scheme. What color combinations are you all into these days?
Zhou Xiuqin: Auntie Wu, I've recently become fascinated with pairing lotus root purple with light gray. I find it quite elegant and understated.
Ma Xiulan: Aunt Wu, Sister Xiuqin, I've really been enjoying pairing dark green with off-white lately.

Ma Xiulan: Unlike the striking contrast of bright red and green, dark green appears steady, while off-white feels warm. When paired together, the embroidered pieces evoke a sense of solidity, tranquility, and a homely atmosphere. The pillowcases I’ve been embroidering recently feature this color combination.
Aunt Wu: Xiulan, this outfit is well put together! It sounds elegant and looks warm. I'll give it a try sometime.
Zhou Xiuqin: Xiu Lan, are you busy? I have some good news about Aunt Wu to tell you!
Ma Xiulan: Not busy, just finished tidying up the house. Aunt Wu, what good news do you have? Tell me quickly.
Zhou Xiuqin: Aunt Wu's community in Cangzhou organized a senior crochet competition, and she won first prize! She was absolutely thrilled.
Ma Xiulan: Oh, that's wonderful! Aunt Wu's skills are so excellent, winning the award is well-deserved.

Zhou Xiuqin: And there's more! Because she won this award, the senior university in her area has taken notice of her and wants to invite her to teach a few crochet classes for the elderly as a temporary instructor. Aunt Wu is hesitant, feeling the responsibility is significant.
Liu Chunmei: Xiulan, have you seen any good TV shows lately? I'm running out of dramas to watch in the evenings.
Ma Xiulan: Chunmei, I'm watching a drama about families in the 1970s and 1980s called "Years Like a Song." It's quite good.
Liu Chunmei: What is it about? What makes it good?
Ma Xiulan: It's about ordinary people's daily lives—dealing with the necessities, raising children. I particularly like the mother in it, named Xiufang.

Ma Xiulan: No matter how difficult things were at home, she never complained. She raised several children single-handedly, and when her husband came home in a bad mood after a frustrating day at work, she endured his temper and kept the household in perfect order. It is both heartbreaking and admirable to see.
Ma Xiufen: Sis, I just had a video call with Yulan, and she's in a bit of a low mood.
Ma Xiulan: Huh? What's wrong? Is there something going on at home?

Ma Xiufen: It's not about her home, it's about her shop. Right next to her shop, a very large chain clothing store opened last month, called something like "Fast Fashion." It's decorated quite beautifully.
Ma Xiulan: It must have been affected. Has the business at her shop declined significantly?

Ma Xiufen: Exactly! She said she's been losing money for the past two months and can barely afford the rent. She's really worried and doesn't know whether to tough it out or just close the shop. Sigh, it's heartbreaking to hear.

Zhou Xiuqin: Xiulan, I've just restocked a batch of silk threads with a particularly comprehensive range of colors. Have you decided which colors to use for the lotus embroidery you're working on lately?
Ma Xiulan: Sister Xiuqin, I've been thinking about it. I don't really like colors that are too flashy; they look unsettling.
Zhou Xiuqin: Then what kind do you like? Some young people prefer embroidering particularly vibrant cartoon patterns.

Ma Xiulan: I can't embroider that. I prefer colors that transition naturally, which are pleasing to the eye. For example, when embroidering petals, I use several shades of pink from light to dark, from the flower's center to the tip of the petals, stitching layer by layer to create a soft and beautiful effect. I think such color combinations are the most enduring and not too glaring.

Zhou Xiuqin: Understood, you like gradient colors, the gentle and soft kind. Alright, I'll pick a few sets of similar pink and green silk threads for you and bring them over this afternoon for you to see.
Wang Guilan: Xiulan, are you home? I just got back from the market and bought some fresh spinach. Would you like me to bring some over?
Ma Xiulan: Sister Wang, I'm here, come on over. I just steamed some buns.

Wang Guilan: Alright, I'm coming. By the way, my sister's son, the one who's studying at university in Tianjin, sprained his ankle while playing football a couple of days ago. My sister was so worried and told him to stay in the dormitory to rest properly and not move around.
Ma Xiulan: Oh, is it serious? Young people recover quickly, but they still need to take good care of themselves. Your sister must be quite worried in Cangzhou.
Liu Chunmei: Xiulan, what have you been up to lately? I haven't seen you post on your Moments for several days.
Ma Xiulan: Chunmei, nothing much, just catching up on TV shows in the evenings. "A Lifelong Journey" is being re-aired, and I watched it again. It's really good.
Liu Chunmei: That drama is a classic. Who is your favorite character in it?

Ma Xiulan: My favorite is Mother Zhou, Li Suhua. Watching her toil for the family and raise all the children, it's truly not easy. Seeing her reminds me of my own mother, who was just like that—spending her whole life for our family, not saying much, but always thinking ahead for you and giving silently.
Liu Chunmei: That's true. Auntie (referring to Li Xiuying) is exactly that kind of person—extremely capable and meticulous. Now that you mention it, it really does sound like her.

Zhiqiang, I went to the vegetable garden today. The lettuce is coming up nicely, but there's a broken spot in the garden fence that needs to be fixed as soon as possible, otherwise it's not safe. Please take a look when you come back tonight.
Zhang Gong: Sister Ma, the rework materials for those two loose hanging accessories you mentioned during the morning quality inspection are now ready, and we can handle them this afternoon.
Aunt Wu: @Xiulan @Xiuqin Sisters, I've been feeling a bit down lately and wanted to share with you.
Zhou Xiuqin: Aunt Wu, what's wrong? Did something happen at home?

Aunt Wu: Oh, it's just about my son's workplace. His unit is conducting professional title evaluations this year. He thought he was a shoo-in for the intermediate title, but it got held up because of his paper.
Ma Xiulan: Huh? What's wrong with the paper? Is it poorly written?

Aunt Wu: It's not that it wasn't good, but the quantity was insufficient. The requirement was to publish at least two papers, but he only managed one. Since he didn't meet the mandatory criteria, he was directly eliminated. This kid usually just focuses on getting the work done and didn't pay enough attention to this matter. He's been feeling down at home these past few days.
Liu Chunmei: Xiulan, are there any good TV series to recommend lately? I have nothing to do in the evenings.

Ma Xiulan: Chunmei, I've been watching that show "Family Harmony Brings Prosperity" lately. It airs on Tianjin TV in the evenings. It tells stories about several families and feels very close to real life.
Liu Chunmei: Oh, that one. I've also glanced at it a couple of times. The female boss in there is quite formidable.

Ma Xiulan: The female boss is capable, but I prefer the daughter-in-law of the Zhang family, the one named Lin Wanjun. Look at how well she takes care of the elderly and children at home. Her husband comes home from work to a warm meal. Although she doesn't work outside, she manages the household harmoniously and stays calm and resourceful when facing challenges. I think such a woman is truly remarkable.
Liu Chunmei: Haha, so you've found a kindred spirit! Alright, I'll also check out this Lin Wanjun tonight.
Li Xiuyun: Xiulan, are you busy? I have some good news to tell you!
Ma Xiulan: Elder sister, I'm not busy, I just finished tidying up the house. What good news is it that has you so happy?
Li Xiuyun: Our Xiaohui's high school entrance exam results are out! Guess what?
Ma Xiulan: Oh, come on, tell me! How did you do on the exam? It must have been great, right?

Li Xiuyun: This kid, usually so quiet and unassuming, really made us proud this time! His total score placed him in the top 50 in Daxing District! I just got the notice that he has been admitted to a key municipal high school! My heart can finally rest easy.
Ma Xiulan: That's wonderful, big sister! Congratulations! Xiao Hui is truly amazing! Now you and brother-in-law can rest easy. I must tell Xuanxuan later, so he can learn from his cousin.
Zhou Xiuqin: Xiulan, there are many new types of embroidery threads available online recently, all colorful and vibrant. Have you seen them?
Ma Xiulan: I've seen them, Sister Xiuqin. There are indeed many varieties, including silk threads, blended threads, and those with gold and silver filaments. It's quite dazzling to look at.
Zhou Xiuqin: Which one do you think works better? I'd like to stock up on some new products.

Ma Xiulan: If you ask me, the cotton thread we commonly use is still the best. It has a substantial feel, the colors are true, and most importantly, it's affordable—perfect for everyday embroidery projects.
Ma Xiulan: The blended thread is also quite good. It's sturdier and more durable than pure cotton, making it great for embroidering things like shoe pads and school bags.

Ma Xiulan: I dislike that kind of thread with gold and silver filaments the most. It looks shiny, but it's flashy without substance, extremely expensive, and particularly prone to snagging during embroidery. If you're not careful, it breaks easily, making it impractical. It's only occasionally used for making festive small ornaments during holidays.
Zhou Xiuqin: Haha, that's pretty much what I thought. It's better to be practical. I'll start by ordering a small quantity of blended fabric to test it out.

Mom and Dad, I'm coming to your place to see you today. There's something I wanted to mention. This morning while buying groceries, I heard from Aunt Sun at the market that there will be a lively event at the Jingwen Road Community Center on the evening of the Lantern Festival, featuring lantern riddles and small performances. Will you be free then? Shall we go check it out together?
Liu Chunmei: Xiulan, what are you busy with at home?
Ma Xiulan: I just finished tidying up the house and was about to take a break. How about you? Are you off work today?
Liu Chunmei: I'm off duty today. By the way, let me tell you something. You know Zhao Xiaohong, our elementary school classmate, right?
Ma Xiulan: Yes, I know her, Xiao Hong. What happened to her?

Liu Chunmei: Sigh, she was working as a cashier at the supermarket a couple of days ago. Probably because she was too tired, her hand slipped, and she accidentally overcharged a customer by 50 yuan. The customer came back later, and her face turned pale at that moment. She kept apologizing and refunded the money. These past two days, she has been telling me how upset she feels, thinking she wasn't careful enough with her work and worrying that her supervisor might criticize her.

Zhou Xiuqin: Xiulan, I've just bought a new batch of embroidery threads with a complete range of colors. There are some very bright ones, as well as those in muted pinkish-gray tones. Do you have any new ideas lately?
Ma Xiulan: Sister Xiuqin, I was just about to tell you. I find myself increasingly drawn to colors that look particularly comfortable and unobtrusive.
Zhou Xiuqin: For example? Be more specific, so I can check if the ones I bought are included.

Ma Xiulan: Colors like off-white, light coffee, and apricot yellow—those that resemble the hues of soil and wheat stalks—are warm and soft. Using them together for embroidery feels particularly grounding and cozy, and they look enduringly pleasant in a home setting. I'm not particularly fond of overly vibrant colors or those sugary pinks and blues that look like candy wrappers; they feel less dignified. Traditional navy blues, on the other hand, can be a bit too heavy.

Zhou Xiuqin: I see, you have a preference for earth tones! These colors indeed look sophisticated and soft. I have several skeins in this color palette among the threads I bought. I'll show them to you another day.

Elder Sister: Xiulan, I just got off the phone with Mom. She mentioned that your back has been feeling much better lately and that you've been consistently practicing the Eight-Section Brocade exercises. That's really great.
Ma Xiulan: Yes, sister. Practicing with Mom every day now, I feel much more relaxed and limber. How about you? Is the supermarket busy?
Older Sister: Don't even mention it. There's been a lot going on lately. Our store's stock clerk, Xiao Zhang—the one who married here from Hebei—her son got into trouble at school.
Ma Xiulan: Huh? What happened? Is the child alright?

Elder Sister: Sigh, teenage boys have such fiery tempers. He got into a fight with a classmate over a basketball court and ended up injuring the other boy's arm. Xiao Zhang has been taking time off work these past few days, constantly running to the school, and still has to cover the medical expenses. It's really worrying. So, you see, children become even more of a concern as they grow older. How are your Xuanxuan and Zhezhe doing at school?
Sister Xiuqin: Xiu Lan, the batch of embroidery threads I ordered online last time has arrived, and the colors are quite comprehensive. What new patterns have you been embroidering lately?
Ma Xiulan: Sister Xiuqin, I was just about to talk to you. Recently, I've been embroidering a small pillowcase for Xinxin and I'm considering the color scheme.
Sister Xiuqin: For children's items, it's better to use bright colors; they look cheerful.

Ma Xiulan: I used to think the same way. But now I feel that overly vibrant colors can be unsettling to look at. Recently, I've been particularly fond of using off-white as a base, paired with light brown branches and vines, and accented with a touch of lotus pink flowers.

Ma Xiulan: This color combination looks particularly soft and gentle. Having it in the room makes you feel warm inside, giving off that cozy, homey vibe. It’s much more enduringly pleasing than bold reds and greens. What do you think?
Aunt Wu (Handicraft Group): Ladies, I have some good news to share! My son Xiaogang recently found a good job in Tianjin Binhai New Area, working as a mechanical maintenance technician.
Zhou Xiuqin (Handicraft Group): Oh my, this is wonderful news, Aunt Wu! Congratulations! Is the child going to move from Cangzhou to there?
Aunt Wu (Handicraft Group): Yes, Xiuqin, I'm in the middle of moving. It'll be more convenient for me to visit you in Tianjin in the future, and I might even be able to stay a few extra days.
Ma Xiulan (Handicraft Group): I'm truly happy for Aunt Wu! When children achieve success, parents can rest assured. In the future, when you come to Tianjin, we'll be able to spend more time together.

Zhou Xiuqin (Handicraft Group): Xiulan is right. Aunt Wu, your son is in the Binhai New Area, which is not too far from Xiulan’s Jinghai District and my place. It’ll be much more convenient for us to visit each other in the future. But Xiulan, does this affect your daily grocery shopping and cooking?
Ma Xiulan (Handicrafts Group): What impact could there be, haha. I'm just happy for Aunt Wu. Having a stable job for her child is a big deal, but we'll carry on with our own lives as usual.
Liu Chunmei: Xiulan, what have you been up to lately? I haven't seen you post on your Moments for several days.
Ma Xiulan: What else could I be busy with? The third child has a bit of a cough, and I just got him to sleep. Now I have a moment of peace and am watching TV.
Liu Chunmei: What are you watching? Another one of those sentimental dramas you're so fond of?

Ma Xiulan: Not at all. I haven't been interested in those romance stories lately. I switched to a different channel and have been watching "Harmony Brings Prosperity," which is a show about mediating family conflicts.
Liu Chunmei: Oh, you've changed your taste? I've caught a glimpse of that program too—it's all noisy and clamorous.

Ma Xiulan: It is quite noisy, but sometimes when I see the troubles in other families and then think about my own, I feel that our ordinary, uneventful life is actually quite good. Moreover, some of the things the mediator says make sense, and it doesn’t hurt to listen. It’s more practical than watching cooking shows—it’s not like we’re actually going to follow those recipes anyway.
Liu Chunmei: Xiulan, are you busy? I just heard something that left me feeling quite unsettled.
Ma Xiulan: Chunmei, I just finished tidying up the house. What's the matter? It sounds quite serious.
Liu Chunmei: It's Zhao Xiaohong. You remember her, right? Our elementary school classmate, the one who works as a cashier at the supermarket.
Liu Chunmei: Isn't her husband working at a construction site? He fell off the scaffolding a couple of days ago and broke his leg. I heard it's quite serious, and he needs to be hospitalized.
Ma Xiulan: Oh my goodness! What a mess. Her family relies on her husband's income, so life is going to be even tougher now. Should we go check on her or offer some help?
Zhou Xiuqin: Xiulan, have you produced any new works recently? I feel the petals of the peony I embroidered aren't three-dimensional enough.
Ma Xiulan: Sister Xiuqin, I was just about to tell you. I recently learned "seed embroidery" from an online tutorial, which creates small, bead-like stitches.

Ma Xiulan: I think this stitching technique is particularly suitable for embroidering flower centers or small fruits, as it creates a raised, plump effect. I tried embroidering a few small pomegranates, and the results were quite good.
Zhou Xiuqin: Seed stitch! I know that technique. It's time-consuming, but the effect is truly remarkable. Now that you mention it, I recall it's most brilliant for embroidering grapes and lychees!
Ma Xiulan: Exactly, that's the feeling! It's particularly suitable for depicting those round, vibrant things. I'll send you the tutorial link later, and we can explore it together.
Zhou Xiuqin: Xiulan, are you home? I just finished a video call with Aunt Wu, and she seems a bit down.
Ma Xiulan: I'm here, Sister Xiuqin. What's wrong with Aunt Wu? Is she feeling unwell?
Zhou Xiuqin: It's not about her health; she's worried about her son. Her son went on a blind date in Cangzhou, but it didn't work out.
Ma Xiulan: Sigh, it's not easy for young people to find a partner these days. What was the reason it didn't work out?

Zhou Xiuqin: Aunt Wu said that the girl's family disapproves of her son's unstable job—he works in sales at a private company, which they consider insecure. This has been weighing on Aunt Wu so much that she hasn't been able to hold her crochet needle steady these past couple of days.
Li Xiuyun: Xiulan, what have you been up to lately? I saw you posted a screenshot from a TV series on your Moments.
Ma Xiulan: Big sister, I'm watching that show "Myriad Lights," which tells the story of an entire family, young and old. It's quite down-to-earth.
Li Xiuyun: Is it good? I'll look for it to watch too. Who is your favorite character in it?

Ma Xiulan: My favorite is the actress who plays the mother, Teacher Liu Min. She shoulders all the big and small matters at home, endures grievances without complaint, and bears everything in silence. It’s particularly heart-wrenching to watch, but also feels very real.
Li Xiuyun: Well, such characters really resonate with people. Isn't our mother just like that too? She's spent her whole life worrying about the family.
Zhou Xiuqin: Xiulan, are you busy? I just finished a video call with Aunt Wu. Her little grandson made her so worried a few days ago.
Ma Xiulan: Huh? What's wrong, Sister Xiuqin? Is Aunt Wu's grandson okay?

Zhou Xiuqin: While chasing and playing with other children in kindergarten, she accidentally fell and hit her knee on the edge of a step, requiring three stitches. Aunt Wu said that when she received the call from the teacher, her heart sank.
Ma Xiulan: Ouch, that sounds painful. Children recover quickly, so they should be feeling much better now, right?

Zhou Xiuqin: Yes, Aunt Wu said that now the stitches have been removed, and the child is running around the house again as if nothing happened, just leaving a small scar. She also said that as a grandmother, she can't bear to see the child suffer even a little.
Zhang Shufen: Xiulan, I see that plot of land in your yard is empty. What do you plan to plant this spring?

Ma Xiulan: Shufen, I've been thinking about it! I've always wanted to turn the yard into a small garden. What I most want to plant are roses—they're beautiful, easy to care for, and have a long blooming period.
Zhang Shufen: Roses are nice. I have two planted at home. Would you like to grow something else?
Ma Xiulan: Well, I also want to plant hydrangeas, big clusters of them—they look so festive. Additionally, I’d like to grow something edible, like cherry tomatoes. The kids enjoy picking them too.

Zhang Shufen: This combination is great, offering both visual appeal and edible produce. Once the cherry tomatoes are well cultivated, they yield abundantly, enough to feed your three children. If you need seeds or seedlings, let me know. I have connections.

Ms. Li, there will be a spring cleaning event in our residential community this Saturday at 9:00 AM at the central square. Please remember to bring your cleaning tools. The notice is posted on the bulletin board on Ruihe Road in our community.
Liu Chunmei: Xiulan, guess who I saw on Shengli Street yesterday?
Ma Xiulan: Who is it? You look so mysterious.
Liu Chunmei: Zhang Wei! The one from our elementary school class, the one who sat behind you, a bit chubby.
Ma Xiulan: Oh! I remember now, Zhang Weiqiang. What happened to him?

Liu Chunmei: He rented a small shop at the intersection of Shengli Street and Jingwen Road, where he opened a pastry store specializing in traditional Tianjin snacks like Ear-Hole Fried Cake, mahua (fried dough twists), and gaogan (steamed rice cakes). The business appears to be quite thriving.
Zhou Xiuqin: Xiulan, I've just gotten a piece of light cyan cotton cloth, and I'm wondering what pattern to embroider on it. Do you have any new ideas lately?
Ma Xiulan: What a coincidence. I happen to be embroidering a pouch recently, and I am using light cyan fabric for it.
Zhou Xiuqin: Really? What color of thread was used? Still those bright reds and greens?

Ma Xiulan: Not anymore. Lately, for some reason, I’ve been particularly fond of color combinations that are close in shade and pleasing to the eye. Like pairing pale purple with light cyan, or off-white with soft apricot yellow—it feels especially elegant and brings a sense of calm to my mind.

Zhou Xiuqin: That's a good idea! Soft color palettes are indeed nice; they look sophisticated. I'll give it a try later. Those bright reds and greens are fine occasionally, but seeing them every day can be a bit overwhelming.
Eldest Sister: Xiulan, are you home? Is it convenient to video chat? I have something I'd like to talk to you about.
Ma Xiulan: Elder sister, I'm here. I just finished cleaning up the dishes. I'll call you right away.

Elder Sister: Sigh, your brother-in-law's unit has been quite busy lately. Now they're insisting on sending him to Langfang, Hebei for some kind of closed-door training, and he'll be gone for two whole weeks.
Ma Xiulan: Langfang? That's not close. Is brother-in-law willing to go?

Elder Sister: Happy about what? I'm actually quite upset. He said the training has nothing to do with his current job—it's a complete waste of time, and it's so far from home. But since it's arranged by the company, he can't just refuse outright. That's why I'm worried too.
Sister Xiuqin: Xiulan, I saw those newly released gradient silk threads at the market last time. The colors are so vibrant. Have you seen them?
Ma Xiulan: I've watched it, and it's quite good. However, my current selection criteria are a bit different from what I used to think.
Sister Xiuqin: Oh? How is it different? Didn't you always prefer steady colors like sapphire blue and dark green before?

Ma Xiulan: That's right, I always felt those colors were just right. But now, perhaps because I'm getting older, or maybe because I deal with the children's noise and commotion every day, I've come to prefer colors that make me feel calm and comfortable inside.

Ma Xiulan: Colors like pale lotus root purple and light yellow appear gentle and not glaring. I use them to embroider small flowers and leaves, and when placed at home, they make the entire room feel softer. I no longer prefer using bright reds and greens.
Sister Xiuqin: You're absolutely right. The pink color palette does create a warm and cozy atmosphere. I'll give it a try next time.
Liu Chunmei: Xiulan, what are you busy with at home? I just got off work and I'm exhausted.
Ma Xiulan: I just picked up the kids and am about to start cooking. You must be busy at the supermarket lately too, right?
Liu Chunmei: Don't even mention it. We just switched to a new cash register system at the end of last month, and it really gave us a hard time.
Ma Xiulan: Ah? So you all have to learn it from scratch.

Liu Chunmei: That's right, Zhao Xiaohong suffered a loss. She's slow to pick up new things. At the end of March, she overcharged several customers in a row, and they all complained to the manager. She got a scolding and has been feeling down these past couple of days.

Aunt Wu (Handicraft Group): Ladies, I recently saw online that some people use machines to print pattern outlines first and then do hand embroidery. It's called digital printing assistance, and they say it's efficient. What do you all think? @everyone
contactName: Handicraft Exchange Group (Aunt Wu, Zhou Xiuqin, etc.)

message_content: Zhou Xiuqin: Aunt Wu, I've heard about this. It seems quite convenient and suitable for batch processing.
contactName: Handicraft Exchange Group (Aunt Wu, Zhou Xiuqin, etc.)

message_content: Ma Xiulan: Aunt Wu, Sister Xiuqin, I think the joy of making handmade embroidery lies in the process of outlining every stitch and thread by oneself. If we first print the patterns with a machine, it feels like just filling in colors, which lacks a certain charm. I still prefer handling everything by hand, from sketching the design to completing the embroidery. Although it’s slower, it gives me a sense of peace of mind.
contactName: Handicraft Exchange Group (Aunt Wu, Zhou Xiuqin, etc.)

message_content: Aunt Wu: Xiulan makes a good point! The soul of craftsmanship lies in the "hand" and the "work." If machines get too involved, it loses its essence. We should just focus on honing our skills the old-fashioned way.
contactName: Handicraft Exchange Group (Aunt Wu, Zhou Xiuqin, etc.)

message_content: Wang Guilan: Xiulan, are you home? I just steamed some date cakes and would like to bring some over to you.
Ma Xiulan: Sister Wang, you're home. Come on in. I just made some tea.
Ma Xiulan: Sister Wang, how has your daughter been doing at work lately? Is she still at that shop in the city?

Wang Guilan: Ah, I'm worried about this very thing. She works as a salesperson at that clothing store, standing all day long and often complaining about leg pain when she comes home, always saying she's tired. Lately, she keeps mentioning to me that she wants to change jobs.
Ma Xiulan: What kind are you looking to change to?

Wang Guilan: She said she wants to find a job close to home, something like office work, a bit easier. I heard our community service center might be recruiting clerks, and she wants to give it a try. Well, young people have many ideas—let her be.
Zhou Xiuqin: Xiulan, I've seen many new embroidery patterns online recently. I'm sending them for you to take a look. [Image][Image][Image]

Ma Xiulan: Sister Xiuqin, I've received the images. The first one with the dragon and phoenix is too intricate and straining on the eyes; I'm afraid I might not be able to embroider it. The second one with those squares and triangles looks quite trendy, but it feels cold and impersonal, not like the kind of work we do.
Zhou Xiuqin: Haha, that's pretty much what I thought. And what about the third one?

Ma Xiulan: The third one is great! I like it. Look at that little magpie and those few crabapple flowers, so lively and cheerful just to look at. They would definitely look beautiful embroidered on children's clothes or sachets. My Xīn Xīn loves these little animals and flowers.
Zhou Xiuqin: Great minds think alike! I also find these floral, avian, and aquatic motifs most delightful—they carry a traditional charm without appearing outdated. Shall we try this style next time?
The fried noodles with soybean paste today were really delicious, and the children were scrambling to eat them.
Liu Chunmei: Xiulan, are you home? I just heard from my mom that there seems to be some movement at Sister Wang's place across from you.
Ma Xiulan: I'm here, Chunmei. It's about Aunt Wang's son. She's been quite happy these past couple of days.
Liu Chunmei: What's the good news? Are you getting married?

Ma Xiulan: It's not about marriage. Her son found a new job in downtown Tianjin, with a salary much higher than what he earned in Jinghai. He said he would move to rent a place in the city next month. Sister Wang is both happy and a bit reluctant to see him go.
Liu Chunmei: That's a good thing. Young people have opportunities for development. It doesn't have any negative impact on your family, does it?

Ma Xiulan: It won't affect our family in any way; it's just that the neighbor's child has made something of themselves. In the future, when Sister Wang is home alone, I'll just make more effort to go over and keep her company.
Ma Xiufen: Sister, I see Xuanxuan has been doing well in school. What kind of university is he planning to apply to in the future? Do you have any thoughts on that?
Ma Xiulan: It's only the beginning of high school, so there's no need to think that far ahead. However, I've discussed this with my husband, and we don't have particularly high expectations.
Ma Xiufen: So there must be a direction, right? Do you hope he stays in Tianjin or goes to another city?

Ma Xiulan: It's fine if it's not too far away, but not too close either. We think it doesn't necessarily have to be a prestigious university. We can't afford those expensive private ones with exorbitant tuition fees.
Ma Xiufen: That's right, we have to consider the actual situation.

Ma Xiulan: That's right. We just hope he can get into a public, reputable university. One with a good school atmosphere and strict management, so he won't be led astray. We want him to learn some useful knowledge and skills in a down-to-earth manner, so that he can eventually make a living on his own. That would be enough for us.
Li Xiuyun: Xiulan, how has everything been at home lately? I've been feeling a bit troubled and wanted to talk to you about it.
Ma Xiulan: Sis, what's wrong? Did something happen at home? Are the kids all right?

Li Xiuyun: It's your brother-in-law. Their company recently implemented some kind of business restructuring, claiming it was to optimize the structure. As a result, he was notified today that he will be transferred from his current management position to a frontline sales role.
Ma Xiulan: What? That's such a drastic change. Is Brother-in-law willing to accept it?

Li Xiuyun: Of course he's unwilling. He feels it's a blow to his dignity, and the sales pressure is immense. He's discussing it with me right now, saying if it doesn't work out, he might just resign and look for other opportunities. Ah, it's really worrying me.
Zhang Shufen: Xiulan, come to my shop this evening to pick up some eggs. They're newly arrived and quite fresh. We can also have a chat while you're here.
Ma Xiulan: Okay, Shufen. I'll come over right after I finish my meal. I've been watching a TV series lately, and it's left me feeling quite unsettled. I really want to talk to you about it.
Zhang Shufen: What show is it? It even made you feel upset.

Ma Xiulan: It's called "A Little Dilemma," which is about children going to school and attending tutoring classes. The portrayal is so realistic—the parents in the show go to great lengths, buying school district housing and enrolling their kids in various classes, all to secure a good school for them. The competition is so intense that it makes me feel anxious and stressed just watching it.
Zhang Shufen: Oh, I think I've heard of this drama. Does it portray the anxiety of parents nowadays particularly well?

Ma Xiulan: Yes, yes, exactly! That's it. I think the biggest highlight of this drama is that it tears down that thin veil, allowing everyone to see how much conflict can arise in a family for the sake of a child's education, exhausting both parents and children. Watching Xuanxuan and Zhe Zhe, I sometimes can't help but wonder if things will turn out the same way in the future.

Talking with you really helped me unwind. There are so many things that only feel right to share with you. Just think about how many years we've known each other—from wearing split pants as toddlers to now, we've always known each other inside and out. Let's make sure to visit each other more often when we have time. We childhood friends should keep in touch.

Honey, you mentioned on your way back that once I get my driver's license, we could drive to Beijing as a family for a trip. The more I think about it, the more wonderful it sounds! Driving ourselves would be so much more convenient and comfortable, and it would be easier for the kids too. This is really a huge motivation for me to learn how to drive. Let's work hard and make it happen soon!

Honey, on your way back you mentioned that once I get my driver's license, we can drive to Beijing as a family for a trip. The more I think about it, the more wonderful it sounds! Driving ourselves would give us so much freedom, and it would be much more convenient for the kids. This is truly a huge motivation for me to learn how to drive. Let's work hard and make it happen soon!

【Jinghai District Cultural Center】Dear Contestant, Congratulations on advancing to the final round of this year's 'Skilled Hands and Ingenious Craftsmanship' Handicraft Competition. The award ceremony is scheduled to be held at 15:00 on October 26 in the multifunctional hall of our center. You are cordially invited to attend.

Sister Guilan, thank you for your compliments this morning—they’ve given me even more motivation to practice! As we agreed, let’s meet at the usual spot tomorrow morning, rain or shine. I’ve grown so used to practicing every day that skipping even one feels off now.

Sister Guilan, thank you for your praise this morning—it has given me even more motivation to practice! As we agreed, let's meet at the usual spot tomorrow morning, rain or shine. I feel off if I miss a day of practice; it has become a daily habit now.

Sister Shufen, I'll come by around 11 a.m. to drop off some vegetables. I also wanted to ask if you know of any places in your supermarket or nearby that sell a comprehensive range of affordable boarding school supplies? My eldest child is about to start boarding soon.
Mom, I drew a big dinosaur in art class today, and the teacher said it looked great! My sister kept singing in the car. We're almost home.
Mom, I've been practicing that fitness qigong, and my shoulder and neck pain is gone. I feel great. I can teach you if you have time this weekend?
Mom, I've been practicing that fitness qigong, and my shoulder and neck pain is gone. I feel really good. Are you free this weekend? I can teach you.
Zhiqiang: Honey, after dinner tonight, I'll teach you how to link your bank card. As Yuxin said, mobile payment is really convenient.
summarized_info: I received a text message from my husband, Ma Zhiqiang, about teaching me how to bind a bank card in the evening, and he mentioned that our younger daughter, Yu Xin, finds mobile payments convenient.

message_content: Ms. Zheng: The materials and style of the cloth bags have been prepared according to your phone instructions, and the sewing progress is going smoothly. The payment is 50 yuan per bag, totaling 150 yuan for three. Is it acceptable to settle the payment upon delivery?

【XX Bank】Dear customer, a transfer of RMB 1,500.00 was made from your account ending in 1234 to an account ending in 5678 at 15:30. Description: Education Special. Your current balance is XXXX.XX yuan.
You all rest first, I'll practice some Baduanjin before going to bed.

Honey, I just scheduled a comprehensive physical exam for this Wednesday. After taking care of Dad recently, I feel I need to pay more attention to my own health too. We are the pillars of our family, and staying healthy is the key to living a good life.

Sister Xiuqin, thank you so much! The client you introduced, Ms. Li from the city, has just paid the deposit and confirmed the order for the 'Fu' character embroidery! I'm so happy—it's all thanks to your help!
Xiuqin, the insurance has been processed. Zhiqiang's job in freight transport is not easy, but with this traffic accident insurance in place, we can finally feel more at ease.
I arrived at the garden and prepared to start warming up.

Xuanxuan: Mom, I still don't understand how to set up the equation for this word problem.  
Ma Xiulan: Sweetie, don't worry. First, look at what the question is asking and set up the unknown variable. List out all the given conditions one by one and find the equivalent relationship. I'll come help you take a look as soon as I finish what I'm doing. Try writing it out first.
Xiulan, how is Mingzhe feeling today? Please let me know if you need any help.
Xiulan, the pillowcases have been received, and the labor fee has been transferred to you. Please check and confirm. I am very satisfied with this custom order!

Sister Guilan, the Baduanjin exercise I briefly mentioned when we met this morning is actually not difficult to perform. It is particularly effective for relaxing the shoulders and neck, as well as regulating breathing. I have just found a few video links suitable for beginners and will share them with you on WeChat later.
Sweetie, I tried the WeChat payment method you taught me yesterday. I managed to bring up the QR code but was afraid of making a mistake. When do you have time to help me check it again?

Director Wang, hello. This is Ma Xiulan. The traditional fitness exercise suitable for practicing at home that you mentioned in the last lecture is called "Baduanjin," right? I plan to start trying it out soon.

Director Wang, I've been practicing Baduanjin by following instructional videos these past couple of days, and it feels great! The movements aren't difficult, and my body feels very relaxed after each session. Thank you for the recommendation! I plan to set aside some time to practice it every day.
Xiulan, come to my house for dinner tonight. Sister Guilan will also be here. It's just a small gathering among us sisters. Bring your child along.
Auntie Ma, the pillowcase has arrived, and everyone in the family praised the embroidery for being truly exquisite! I have just transferred the remaining payment of 300 yuan via WeChat. Thank you!
Zheng Xiuying: Sister Ma, have all the cloth bags been hemmed and sorted? I'll come to pick them up tomorrow morning and settle the payment.
Everything is ready for breakfast. We're waiting for you to come and eat.
Morning exercise completed. Today I walked for over 20 minutes and practiced the Eight-Section Brocade for 15 minutes.
Son, I took a 25-minute walk this morning and am now practicing the Eight-Section Brocade, which will take about 15 minutes to complete.
I just took a walk along Jingwen Road, and the air was quite pleasant. Today, I switched to exercising at home instead.

Jingjing, I've finished eating and have a bit of a headache, probably from working overtime these past couple of days and getting chilled in the cold weather. I'll rest this afternoon and should be fine.

Director Wang: Hello, Ms. Ma. The training on spring vegetable cultivation has been successfully completed. Thank you for your active participation! I have organized the content from today's lecture and will send it to you. Please feel free to contact me if you have any questions.

Director Wang: Hello, Ms. Ma. The training on spring vegetable cultivation has concluded successfully. Thank you for your active participation! I have organized the content from today's lecture and will send it to you. Please feel free to contact me if you have any questions.

Hello Director Wang, I have finished embroidering all 30 'Fu' character pendants you requested. Please let me know when it would be convenient for me to come to the community and hand them over to you.

Brother, Dad complained of dizziness again last night. I accompanied him for a follow-up examination this morning. His condition has remained unstable recently, which is quite worrying. I need to be with him throughout, so my morning workouts have been reduced to just some light exercises lately.
Sister Xiulan, yesterday's walk felt really good; my back wasn't as stiff. Same time, same place tomorrow afternoon? I'm fine with it.

Sister Xiulan, I have a friend who urgently needs a pillowcase with a peony pattern. They are offering 200 yuan and require it to be completed within three days. Could you see if you can take on this order?

Dad, I've taken care of it as planned yesterday. I opened a dedicated passbook for Xuanxuan at the Agricultural Bank near our home, with a one-year fixed deposit. Five hundred yuan has been deposited, and the purpose is clearly stated. The first step is finally settled.

Old Ma, I spent the morning doing a thorough cleaning at home with the three kids. We wiped the windows and furniture, and it took over two hours. My back is a bit sore now. About what time will you be back tonight?

I weighed myself last night and found I've lost more weight. The past few days of running back and forth to the hospital have been exhausting, and I feel both physically drained and less mentally sharp than before.
I weighed myself last night and found I've lost more weight. These past few days of running around to hospitals have been exhausting—I'm completely worn out and don't feel as energetic as before.

Dear Community Officer Zhang, 

I have left two pieces of framed embroidery at the neighborhood committee for your collection. One is the previously registered circular-themed embroidery, and the other is a recently completed embroidery depicting a canal scene.
Zhiqiang, I followed the steps you taught me, found 'My Deposits' in the mobile banking app, clicked into it, and saw that 5,000 yuan fixed deposit. Is this correct?

Auntie Zhou, good evening. Zhiqiang also thought the "Abundance Year After Year" pattern I traced this afternoon looked good, so we've decided on it. We'll embroider this for the market at the end of the month. What do you think?

Mom, I spent the whole day today accompanying Dad in the Respiratory Medicine Department of Jinghai District Hospital, assisting him with washing, feeding, and recording his vital signs. I barely had any rest, and now I'm experiencing chest tightness and shortness of breath. My body feels so exhausted it's about to fall apart.

Mom, I spent the whole day today accompanying Dad in the Respiratory Medicine Department of Jinghai District Hospital, assisting with washing, feeding, and recording vital signs. I barely rested, and now I'm experiencing chest tightness and shortness of breath. My body feels completely exhausted.

Sister Xiulan, I have just transferred the 200 yuan payment for the 20 pairs of twining flower cup coasters we discussed earlier to you via WeChat. Please check your account. The deadline for this order was quite tight, so I really appreciate your hard work. Thank you for supporting the community project!

Xiulan, seeing you so troubled this afternoon truly made my heart ache. Regarding communicating with Xiaofei, I went through a similar phase when my son was in his rebellious period. My advice is to avoid direct confrontation at all costs. First, calm down and wait until his emotions settle. Then, find a relaxed moment to talk with him like a friend. Don’t rush to criticize—start by listening to what he has to say. And please don’t blame yourself too much; being a mother is never easy.
Xiulan, thanks to you today, the order work was done quickly and well. Leave the remaining packing of these bits and pieces to me, you go and rest now.

Honey, as we discussed last night, I'm going to the Postal Savings Bank now to handle that fixed deposit. After attending the lecture, I still think saving in a fixed deposit is more secure. Let's try a three-year term first.
Xiuqin, I've handed everything over to you. I hope the baby likes it!

Sister-in-law, I just learned a few tips from that health program on TV, which said blanching vegetables before cooking can remove oxalic acid and make the dish healthier. Since your brother finished work early today, I'll try this method tonight and prepare a healthy meal for everyone.

Sister Xiulan, I received the embroidery piece 'Joy on the Brows' you made today—it's absolutely beautiful! My mother-in-law couldn't stop praising it, saying it's even more exquisite than in the photos. I have transferred the remaining payment of 500 yuan to you. Please check and confirm. Thank you so much!

Xiulan: Let's review the report together when we get home tonight. The doctor specifically reminded us this morning that you need to start paying attention to your fatty liver and lumbar spine issues.

Sis, I'll come over tomorrow afternoon, and we'll start the 'Mobile Phone Class' as planned. Don't be nervous; I'll begin with the basics, and I'm sure you'll learn it. Remember to charge your phone fully.
Eldest son, when I was organizing the winter clothes, I noticed that the sleeve of your down jacket has come unstitched. Bring it back when you have time, and I'll sew it for you.
【Jingwen Road Community Service Center】Dear Ms. Ma, your handmade order has been delivered, and the payment of 500 yuan has been transferred to your account. Please check. Thank you for your support!
Xiulan, Dad said he felt chest tightness this afternoon, so I took him to the emergency room. The doctor said he needs to be kept under observation. Are you free to come over tomorrow?
I tried Baduanjin in the yard this morning and felt quite comfortable. Recently, I wanted to add something new to my life, so I gave this a try.
Zhiqiang, the family meeting has concluded, and the plan has been finalized. I will adjust the budget tomorrow.

Mr. Yang, thank you for today's conversation. Regarding the family adjustment plan, the main purpose is to create a quiet environment for our eldest son's high school entrance exam. We also hope you can remind Mingzhe more often at school to stay focused.
Xiulan, don't worry too much, the teaching session will go smoothly tomorrow. I'll come back to fix the water pipe tomorrow.
Mom, thank you for your guidance tonight. You are right—we should listen to our children patiently and avoid lecturing them too much. I will remember that.
Sister Zheng, I'll take on that urgent task you mentioned on WeChat just now. Ten pairs of 'Abundance Year After Year' coasters, to be completed within three days.
summarized_info: I sent a text message to Zheng Xiuying, indicating that I had accepted the urgent order she previously mentioned on WeChat.

message_content: Ma Xiulan: I ran into my neighbor Sister Wang during my morning exercise today and shared my good news from yesterday with her. She was even happier than I was!

Lao Xu, as we discussed this evening, I've deposited the 700 yuan I earned from embroidery this month into the card for Mingxuan's boarding school. From now on, I'll transfer a fixed amount into it first every month when I get my salary. This way, I feel more at ease.

Sister Ma, your subsidy as a community handicraft corner instructor has been disbursed. Please go to the service window of the Jingwen Road No. 16 Community Health Center to collect it on the morning of February 5th. – Zheng Xiuying

Mom: Your father was suddenly hospitalized, and I'm feeling terribly anxious. When you come to relieve me tonight, I noticed you don't look well. You haven't slept for days, so please take care of yourself and don't overwork.
Mingzhe, please keep your voice down when playing with Yuxin in the living room so as not to disturb your brother. Be mindful of this both today and tomorrow.

Ms. Ma Xiulan, hello. The embroidered pendant 'Flowers Blooming in Wealth' that you made has been accepted and approved by the Jingwen Road Community Service Center, and the 500 yuan labor fee has been settled. Thank you for your exquisite work!

Zhiqiang: I'll be at the ward soon and brought some of your favorite snacks. You've been here all day today, so you must be exhausted. Leave the night shift to me—go home and get some proper rest. You'll need to recharge for your birthday tomorrow.
Xiulan, there's a last-minute change in my schedule. I'll be home early this afternoon. Let's have dinner at home tonight.

Mom, did you deposit the 200-yuan subsidy received yesterday together with the remaining money from this month's household funds? Please remember to let me know once it's done. I'll take Lele to try out the painting interest class this weekend.
summarized_info: I received a text message from my husband Ma Jianguo, asking whether the 200 yuan subsidy received yesterday (February 5) had been deposited together with the remaining money at home for this month.

message_content: Happy birthday, my dear! You must be exhausted today. I noticed you seemed quite tired during dinner tonight. You've been worrying about Dad and taking care of everything at home all day, and I can see you've lost some weight. It breaks my heart to see you like this. Please get some rest now and try not to overthink things.
Ma Xiulan: Honey, dinner is almost ready. Let's all be mindful tonight and keep the conversation light and casual. Let's avoid discussing the exams so our child can relax and enjoy the meal.
Ma Xiulan: Xuanxuan, have some more fish. It's good for you.
Received. Agreed. Proceed according to the direction we decided in last night's meeting: eliminate the unnecessary and prioritize achieving the savings target first.

Sister Xiuqin, I'm sorry that I only managed to embroider half of the peony painting this afternoon, as I was interrupted by Yuxin's impromptu craft activity. I'll consult with you another day about the color matching.

Xiulan, regarding the chain stitch turning technique you asked about last time, I've given it some thought since then. The key is to keep your wrist relaxed and ensure the stitches are even. How did your practice go that day?

Elder sister, I have something to tell you. I used to shop at that store frequently, and I heard they are going to close down and have a clearance sale next month. The discounts are quite significant. Would you like to go and take a look?
Sis, is the clearance supermarket you mentioned last time the Hualian Supermarket in Jinghai District? I passed by today and saw a lot of people there.
Yes, it's Hualian Supermarket. I thought I had already told you the name. Have you been there?
Sister Wang, I heard from Sister Zheng that there will be a free medical consultation event in the community next Wednesday. Dr. Wang and the others will all be there. Are you planning to go?
Go ahead, it's a good opportunity to have Dr. Wang check your blood pressure. It's on April 9th, right? Let me make a note of it.
Yes, that's correct, Wednesday morning, April 9th.
Mom, I'd like to have Tianjin steamed buns and sweet and sour pork for dinner. Zhe Zhe and Xin Xin also said they want to eat them.
Chunmei, I went to the market today and saw someone selling Erduoyan fried cakes, which reminded me of how much we loved them when we were kids. Also, jianbing guozi—it's still one of my favorites.
Yes! Just talking about it makes me crave some. Shall we go buy some to eat this weekend?
Sis, there's a particularly lively temple fair in Tianjin during the Spring Festival. I'd like to take the kids, but it's bound to be crowded.
Are you referring to the Ancient Culture Street? I heard on TV that the activities there are quite abundant this year.
Yes, that's the Ancient Culture Street! You really understand me.
Fen'er, there's a TV series about old Tianjin recently that's quite good. I really enjoy watching shows with a bit of historical flavor, and I often watch urban romance dramas as well.
Yulan, I've been spending my evenings watching TV lately. Family ethics dramas are quite interesting and I can learn a lot about handling family matters from them.
Shufen, last week I ran into Aunt Sun at the vegetable market, and she even slipped an extra handful of spring onions into my bag.
Aunt Sun is really nice. Was it also on August 25th that she gave you the cilantro you mentioned last time? My memory is getting worse.
Yes, the coriander is for the 25th. The spring onions I mentioned were from the earlier batch, around the 18th.
Mom, I've been secretly preparing a little gift for your birthday next month, and I hope you'll like it.
Sister Xiuqin, I've finished embroidering the auspicious cloud pattern you gave me last time. It looks really beautiful on the pouch, and my mother is sure to love this traditional style.
Honey, I've been seeing in the news recently that high-speed trains are fast and convenient. I really hope we can take the kids to see Tiananmen Square there someday.
Dad, I'm thinking that once I've saved up enough money, I'll take the kids on a trip to Beijing. My sister also mentioned that it's been a long time since she last saw the kids.

Mom, the school is organizing an autumn outing tomorrow, and I need to pay the activity fee and lunch money. I don't have enough cash on hand. Do you have 200 yuan? I'll come by to get it this afternoon.
Mom, Zhe Zhe has taken a liking to a newly released stationery box at the school gate and is insisting on having it. I have to trouble you again—could you lend me 150 yuan for now?
Sister Wang, I heard you're going to the town market this afternoon? Could you help me buy some embroidery thread? I need two small spools each of royal blue and goose yellow. Thank you!

Lihua, the royal blue and canary yellow threads I bought last time have come in handy. I embroidered several coasters with them, and the color combination is particularly refreshing. I'll save a pair for you if you'd like them.
Master Liu, sorry to trouble you again. It seems the kitchen pipe in my home is having a similar issue to last time. When would it be convenient for you to come take a look?
Master Liu, I really appreciate your help last time. It was about the section of water pipe under the kitchen sink—the joint kept leaking intermittently, and you mentioned it was due to pipe aging.
Fen'er, Xuanxuan did fairly well in his final exams this time. It wasn't in vain that I supervised his homework every day—one of his subjects even scored above 90.
Mom, Xuanxuan scored 91 points on his math test, and he is quite happy about it himself. The teacher said he has made progress.

Auntie Wu, regarding the plot in my small vegetable garden, I'd like to try the mixed composting method you mentioned. What was the specific ratio of chicken manure to vegetable leaves you suggested last time? I wrote it down in my notebook, but it seems my second child used it for drawing, and now I can't find it.

Xiulan, the ratio is 3:7, with three parts chicken manure and seven parts vegetable leaves or rotten fruit peels. Wait a moment, I have a more detailed list of precautions here. Let me take a photo and send it to you.

Auntie Sun, the spinach that just arrived today looks so fresh and crisp, I'll take two jin. By the way, have you seen Auntie Wu these past couple of days? I asked her about something a few days ago, and she said she would send me a picture, but I haven't received it yet.

Oh, Xiulan, you haven't heard yet? Old Wu is in the hospital! Just the night before last, she suddenly felt terribly dizzy, and her daughter rushed her to the city hospital overnight. It's probably a hypertension flare-up, so she needs a thorough check-up. So, as for your drawing, you won't be getting it anytime soon.

Honey, Teacher Xuanxuan mentioned that our child has been lowering his head too much while writing lately, which raises concerns about his eyesight. I was wondering if we should get him a better study desk lamp. Do any of your colleagues at the logistics company have recommendations for good brands based on their own purchases?

You can decide on this matter. Brother Zhao's child seems to be using that kind of adjustable light, called something like "Bright Doctor" or "Clear Vision," I can't quite remember. You should ask the teacher; they know better.

Hello Teacher Han, I am Ma Mingxuan's mother. I am considering getting a new eye-protection desk lamp for my child, but there are so many brands on the market that I feel overwhelmed. I would like to ask, based on your experience, if you have any recommended brands of desk lamps for students? Thank you!

Hello, Mingxuan's Mom. Indeed, good lighting is very important for children. Many teachers at our school have purchased the 'Hutongbao' brand for their children.
