It provides uniform and soft light, features stepless dimming, and offers good value for money. You can check it out on the official online flagship store, as there are often promotions available.
Sis, I saw the late-night snack photos you posted on your Moments. Working overtime again until so late? You really need to take better care of your health.

Oh, don't even mention it. The store has recently launched some new pilot program, which changed both the scheduling and evaluation systems. It's thrown everyone into chaos and put us under immense pressure. Let me fill you in on the details once this busy period is over.

Sister Wang, have you seen this news? It says that several districts in Beijing have started piloting a 4.5-day workweek, encouraging people to take off on Friday afternoons. This policy is really great—I wish we had it here too.

I've seen it, and it looks good. However, the news also mentioned that pilot enterprises need to make adjustments based on actual conditions to ensure the total working hours remain unchanged. It is estimated that when it is first implemented, the workers will need some time to adapt. Issues like scheduling shifts and arranging tasks will all need to be addressed.

Sister Xiuqin, look at this link quickly! The news report says there's a traditional embroidery in our Tianjin that is on the verge of being lost. It's called the 'Hundred Children of Tianjin Embroidery,' featuring one hundred children playing various games, all vividly depicted. It says that the elderly masters who knew how to embroider it are no longer around.

Oh my, I think I've heard my grandmother's generation mention this before. They said it was incredibly time-consuming, with a single set of patterns taking several years to embroider. I wonder if any complete works have survived to this day. I'd really love to see one with my own eyes.

Yulan, didn't you mention last time that you wanted to find some old embroidery pieces for design reference? I recently saw news about an embroidery work called "Hundred Children of Tianjin," but I'm not sure where to see the actual piece.

Xiulan, what a coincidence! I went to the Tianjin Museum last week to see a folk craft exhibition and actually came across an embroidered piece of the "Hundred Children" painting. I wonder if it's the one you mentioned. It was displayed in a glass case on the second floor—absolutely exquisite! Unfortunately, photography wasn't allowed.
Ms. Wang, I saw a notice on the bulletin board downstairs saying there's a community event this Saturday afternoon. Do you know what it's specifically about?

I know, it's the local fire department giving a lecture on the topic of 'Home Fire Safety.' They'll teach how to inspect for hazards, use fire extinguishers, and handle oil pan fires. I heard they also give out a small gift after the lecture, so I plan to attend.
Honey, there's a community fire safety lecture this Saturday. Would you like to attend? It'll give us more peace of mind at home after learning about it.

Can't make it. The company just issued a notice that all drivers must attend mandatory safety training in batches this weekend. The main content covers daily vehicle inspections and emergency response to sudden fires. It's probably similar to what your community has discussed—all about fire safety.
Fen, it's getting cold, and Mom keeps talking about you. When will you have some free time to come back to Jinghai? Let's get together, and we can also visit our parents.

Sis, I'm feeling homesick too! I've already arranged my shifts with the store, so I can go back next week. I'll let you know the exact day once I've finalized it—likely in the latter half of the week. I want to stay home for a couple of extra days.
Mom, Fen'er said she's coming back next week. Did she tell you the exact date? I want to prepare some of her favorite dishes in advance.

Yes, she just called me. She's scheduled to arrive this Friday afternoon, the 14th. She said she'll be taking the bus back. Your dad has been urging me since early morning to buy pork ribs, saying we need to stew them for our daughter's return.

While having lunch, I was scrolling through Kuaishou and came across a video teaching how to make cartoon-style steamed buns with red bean paste filling. They looked particularly adorable, and I'm sure Yuxin would love them.
Zhiqiang, I've arrived home first and am about to prepare lunch. Around what time will you be back? I attended the community cleaning event this morning and returned just in time to cook.

Me: Mingzhe, Mom made fish and vegetables today, so eat more.  
Mingzhe: Okay, Mom.
Wang Guilan: Xiulan, summer is here and mosquitoes are becoming increasingly rampant. It's really a headache. Do you have any good methods for dealing with mosquitoes at your home?

Ma Xiulan: Sister Guilan, do you remember our conversation about mosquitoes last time? I tried burning some mugwort to fumigate my house last night, and it worked very well in repelling mosquitoes. You might want to try this traditional method.
Ma Xiulan: Doctor, my father has a history of hypertension and is currently managing it with medication. Are there any additional tests or precautions needed before receiving the flu vaccine?

【Yonghui Supermarket】Your order (#202510010827) has been dispatched by delivery driver Master Liu (Phone: 138****1234) and is expected to arrive at 08:50. The order includes: 500g pork tenderloin, 1 bundle of green vegetables, 4 tomatoes, 10 eggs, 5kg flour, etc. We wish you a pleasant shopping experience!
Mom, we're on our way and will arrive soon. Can the kids take a shower directly? There's also a pile of clothes to wash.
Xiufen, I've given it some thought, and I've decided to make hair coloring a regular part of my grooming routine.
Ma Xiulan: Just set off on an electric bike with Yuxin to go to kindergarten. Be safe on the road.

Xiulan: Zhiqiang, I'm back. I went out this morning hoping to run into Wang Guilan across the hall by chance, to ask about the specific procedures for enrolling our youngest daughter in school. I've read the official documents several times, but the requirements for community stamps and photocopies are still ambiguous. I didn't dare to handle it carelessly myself, for fear of making mistakes and causing delays. Fortunately, I met her. Sister Wang is very warm-hearted and shared a lot of practical experience.

Xiulan: By the way, Sister Wang specifically reminded us that the photocopies of the household register should include the main page, the child's page, and the parents' pages. The community seal must be stamped in the designated location on the application form and cannot be placed randomly. These details aren't specified in the documents. It's always a good idea to ask those with experience.
Sister Wang, I'm feeling a bit down today.
What's wrong, Xiulan? Would you like to go for a walk tonight?
It's nothing, just feeling a bit sentimental. There's something going on at home tonight, so I won't be going out.
Wang Guilan: Xiulan, thank you so much for helping tidy up the garden today! Talking about the children's studies, I really need to find time to manage it.
Wang Guilan: Xiulan, don't forget to check the community notice we discussed during our meeting today.
Sister Xiuqin, yesterday's tea party was a great success! I was even praised as a volunteer, and my parents were especially happy when they found out!
Dad, Mom and I are receiving moxibustion therapy at the Chaoyang Street Community Hospital in Jinghai District. We should finish around 11 o'clock.

Mom, the family gathering this weekend is all set, and the pickling activity is the highlight. You must come and oversee it! The whole family will be working together, and the kids miss you too. Let's all get together and have a lively time.
Xiulan: I have verified all the accounts recorded on the 11th of last month, and they are clearly documented, including the property sanitation fee, which was also photographed and archived.
Aunt Guilan, have you had lunch yet? I'd like to discuss something about the child's schooling with you. Is it convenient to talk at home?

Zhiqiang, regarding the coal briquettes we discussed yesterday, please proceed with the order according to the agreed quantity. It should be slightly less than last year, as we need to allocate funds to more urgent matters. However, make sure that our parents' room is kept warm without fail.
Zhang Shufen: Xiulan, for the hair dye you inquired about, I recommend Schwarzkopf; the color lasts longer.
Honey, I've recorded the May expense budget in the memo. For Zhang Wei's wedding gift, 300 yuan—do you think that's appropriate?
Zhiqiang: Regarding Mingxuan's mobile phone usage, let's establish some rules together tonight, and then review them with the children during dinner.
Chunmei: I really enjoyed our tea chat today. Thank you for your advice on how to communicate with Mingxuan. I'll try to encourage more and criticize less.
Xiulan, I will arrive at Jinghai Station around 1 p.m. Will you come to pick me up?
Xiulan, the weather suddenly turned cold today. We need to quickly discuss our winter preparations. When are you available to talk?

Mom, I've been learning to make digital photo albums recently. I used the photos from our family dinner last week and added some music to it. It turned out quite nice. I'll show it to you this weekend!
